bug.author: RapIt
bug.summary: Change of Visualization Parameters between versions?
bug.description:
I did a version update from 0.7 to 0.8 today. I did absolutely no other changes than adjusting the API calls which changed between the versions, but my visualization broke anyway: left: 0.7 / right: 0.8 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/844913/65345210-041eed80-dbda-11e9-9fd5-5022a84a9938.png></denchmark-link>
the color map changed the zoom-limit in the newer version is lower so that I cannot zoom far enough. the point cloud is smaller because the z-translation value in the extrinsic matrix changed (except of this single value both intrinsic, extrinsic and other ViewControl parameters are exactly the same. PCL values are also the same. )
The old version is way better, but I would like to use some of the new features. A hint into the right direction in the changelog / code would be great. I have no clue what to change in order to restore the old behavior. I only use default parameters so far and add my geometries (PCLs and MeshSpheres) with add_geometry. Thanks! EDIT I made some further observations: The ViewTrajectory is <denchmark-code>"boundingbox_max" : [ 0.97073449050827609, 0.76746450924137721, 0.0 ], "boundingbox_min" : [ -1.1379995291273886, -0.7524822081574073, -2.4096000194549561 ], "field_of_view" : 59.999999999999993, "front" : [ 0.0, 0.0, 1.0 ], "lookat" : [ -0.08363251930955623, 0.0074911505419849589, -1.204800009727478 ], "up" : [ 0.0, 1.0, 0.0 ], "zoom" : 0.40847723131794877 </denchmark-code>
,but when I manually print the bbox values before adding the pcl to the renderer its max values are [0.97073449 0.76746451 -1.1128], so the z value is falsely set to 0.0. That causes the lookat to be calculated wrong, too and the colormap is applied to a "wrong" range. That does not happen in the 0.7 version, the max bbox values are correct there. How can I fix that? EDIT 2 I fixed it for me by building from source after setting the z value of max_bound_ in
Open3D/src/Open3D/Geometry/BoundingVolume.h
Line 94 in 80915c2
max_bound_(0, 0, 0),
to a negative limit. The issue is caused by the combination of bounding boxes when adding 3d geometries, see
Open3D/src/Open3D/Geometry/BoundingVolume.h
Line 118 in 80915c2
max_bound_ = max_bound_.array().max(other.max_bound_.array()).matrix();
. Since the z axis is negative, the initial value of 0.0 is always greater, so the BoundingVolume is not calculated correctly.

comments.comment: Ditto. Updated to 0.8, previously calling draw_geometries() would display a zoomed-in view of point clouds, regardless of there points where (useful for quick viewing results). Now point clouds are far away from the center and in a zoomed out view which is not optimal. There is no documentation of the changes either. Any ideas how to revert back to the older viewing functionality? Thanks!

See my EDIT 2 for a fix, which worked for me. It probably solves the issue, but I am not familiar enough with the code and potential side effects to make a PR. Maybe <denchmark-link:https://github.com/griegler>@griegler</denchmark-link> can comment, he implemented the new bounding volume features.
Thanks for pointing this out, I will need to look a bit deeper into this.
